p:
Glucocorticoid (GC) use in patients with HBV infection was known to relate to HBVr as early as the 1970s,
18 although its reported incidence varies significantly in the published literature (4–50%). The proposed pathophysiological mechanism seems to be twofold: GCs suppress T-cell cytotoxic function, thus diminishing the host’s immune check on the virus, but also directly stimulate HBV-DNA replication by activating a GC-responsive transcriptional regulatory element in the HBV genome.
